Corporates shift to short-term bonds amid slow bank rate cuts in India
description: Indian corporates are increasingly favoring the bond market, particularly short-term bonds, due to banks' slow response to rate cuts. Liquidity infusion by the RBI has significantly lowered short-term bond yields, prompting this shift. AAA-rated companies find bond yields more attractive than bank MCLR rates, while lower-rated firms may still prefer bank credit.

title: Why are more promoters pledging their shares in Nifty 500 companies?
description: During January-March, promoter stake pledges increased for 27 Nifty 500 companies, including Aadhar Housing Finance and Max Financial Services. While pledging isn't inherently alarming, it raises concerns when a company's fundamentals are weak, potentially amplifying negative impacts if business performance is already questionable.

title: Why It's Time to Retire the Idea of Retirement with Derek Coburn
description: Derek Coburn is a seasoned financial advisor, entrepreneur, and bestselling author of Networking Is Not Working. He is the co-founder of Cadre, an exclusive community for CEOs and entrepreneurs, and a respected voice on redefining success and fulfillment. In this episode, Derek dives into the ideas behind his new book Let‚Äôs Retire Retirement, challenging the outdated notion of traditional retirement and offering a fresh, liberating approach to living well now and later. Listeners will gain valuable insights on how to align financial planning with purpose, connection, and long-term joy‚Äîwithout waiting for ‚Äúsomeday.‚Äù Today we discussed: 00:00 Introducing Derek Coburn 00:45 The true history of retirement: Bismarck, FDR, and outdated milestones 03:24 Why 25‚Äì30% of retirees are going back to work 04:50 The concept of redefining retirement for personal fulfillment 07:37 Entrepreneurs and the myth of I‚Äôll do it after I exit 08:49 Real-world case study: Jay Baer's pivot from agency to tequila influencer 10:13 Financial math: how working longer cuts required savings dramatically 12:07 The 401(k) rethink: taxes, Roth conversions, and planning smarter 13:38 Parenting, presence, and valuing your $50,000 moments 14:58 The mindset shift needed to fully embrace this new paradigm More About Derek Coburn: Pre-order Let's Retire Retirement and access exclusive bonuses: https://DerekCoburn.com Rate, Review, & Follow If you liked this episode, please rate and review the show. title: How Leaders Should Really Use AI
description: Geoff Woods is the #1 international bestselling author of The AI-Driven Leader: Harnessing AI to Make Faster Decisions and the founder of AI Leadership and the AI Driven Leadership Collective. As a former Chief Growth Officer of a global company, Geoff brings real-world expertise in using AI to transform how leaders think and make decisions. In this episode, he reveals how AI can serve as a powerful thought partner‚Äîenhancing strategic focus, overcoming operational overwhelm, and unlocking breakthrough solutions using his CRIT framework. Tune in to learn how the most effective leaders are leveraging AI to stay ahead in a rapidly evolving business landscape. Today we discussed: 00:00 Opening 00:48 Introducing Geoff Woods 01:19 How AI Enhances Leaders Strategic Thinking 03:17 AI as a Thought Partner 04:46 How AI Can Help with Operation Tasks 06:16 Focusing on the 20% 07:52 The C.R.I.T. Framework 13:11 Addressing the AI Culture Shift 16:22 How is AI Changing Decision Making 17:45 What's AI's Role in Leadership 19:28 How to Start Integrating AI Into Your Leadership Practices More About Geoff Woods: The AI-Driven Leader by Geoff Woods on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/AI-Driven-Leader-Harnessing-Smarter-Decisions/dp/B0DB8QL3ZK?utm_source=chatgpt.com Rate, Review, & Follow If you liked this episode, please rate and review the show. title: #2275 He‚Äôs doing SEO on ChatGPT
description: Have you noticed how AI search results are now linking to websites? Today‚Äôs guest runs an SEO agency that helps his clients‚Äô sites show up in those chat responses. I invited Chirag Kulkarni founder of Taco to talk about how he‚Äôs doing it and how he built his agency. Chirag Kulkarni is the founder and CEO of Taco, an AI-powered SEO firm helping brands dominate emerging search platforms. Chirag and his team are building Taco into the go-to partner for companies navigating the shift from Google to generative search. More interviews -> https://mixergy.com/moreint Rate this interview -> https://mixergy.com/rateint
author: Andrew Warner

title: #2274 1440: $20+mil / year newsletter
description: After closing a company that failed, Tim Huelskamp decided to keep it simple. He launched an email newsletter that briefed smart people about the day‚Äôs top news. Today his company, 1440, has over 4 million subscribers and generates over $20 million in annual revenue Tim Huelskamp is the co-founder of 1440, the fact-focused daily newsletter. Tim and his team are building 1440 into a trusted source for intellectually curious readers who want an inch-deep, mile-wide view of the world. More interviews -> https://mixergy.com/moreint Rate this interview -> https://mixergy.com/rateint
author: Andrew Warner

title: Stablecoin issuer Circle prices IPO at $31 per share, above expected range, ahead of NYSE debut
description: Circle, the issuer of one of the biggest stablecoins, priced its IPO at $31per share, above its expected range and giving it a market value of $6.8 billion.

title: Musk whips opposition to Trump tax plan: 'KILL the BILL'
description: Musk's reaction likely comes in part because Trump's bill cuts an EV tax credit that helps Tesla, a source familiar with the matter told NBC News.

title: What Leaders Get Wrong About Listening
description: Listening well is an essential aspect of leadership - not just to maintain good relationships with employees, but to drive real business improvements and results. But many of us still get it wrong - or might think we are good listeners but don't give that impression to our teams. Jeff Yip, assistant professor of management at Simon Fraser University‚Äôs Beedle School of Business, explains why the skill is so important to business success and identifies the five main mistakes leaders make when it comes to listening. He is coauthor, along with Colin Fisher of University College London, of the HBR article ‚ÄúAre You Really A Good Listener?‚Äù

title: Does the Tech Industry Need a Reboot?
description: Although¬†we‚Äôve¬†seen great successes come out of the technology sector in recent decades, many critics¬†‚Äî¬†and even some insiders¬†‚Äî¬†say it‚Äôs due for an overhaul. As a longtime Silicon Valley engineer and executive and¬†cofounder of the Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing conference,¬†Telle Whitney argues that tech culture is still too closed-off and unwelcoming to different points of view, which leads to products and services that¬†aren‚Äôt¬†as good as they could be¬†‚Äî¬†for consumers and society. She thinks the¬†industry¬†‚Äî¬†and corporate tech departments¬†‚Äî¬†can stay¬†innovative while also becoming more inclusive¬†and¬†shares her¬†advice for leaders who want to help.¬†Whitney is the author of the new book¬†Rebooting Tech Culture: How to Ignite Innovation and Build Organizations Where Everyone Can Thrive.

title: Aditya Birla Group buys Cargill's speciality chemical facility in US
description: The Dalton plant will see capacity more than double in two years as Aditya Birla Group integrates advanced materials tech and eyes expansion across strategic sectors

title: Carlyle group exits Indegene; sells 10.2% stake for Rs 1,447 crore
description: According to the bulk deal data available on the NSE, US-based Carlyle group, through its arm CA Dawn Investments, sold more than 2.44 crore shares, amounting to a 10.20 per cent stake in Indegene

title: Turf Wars, Tree Men & Murder: Inside the world of Christmas tree selling in NYC
description: Christmas trees are big business in NYC. Running a tree lot takes grit and experience, and even then, it's a tough network to break into. All of the lots in the city are divided into separate territories, owned by only a handful of entrepreneurs. We spent the day working for NYC's busiest Christmas tree seller on Greg Walsh's busiest day of the year to better understand the wild logistics behind NYC‚Äôs Christmas tree economy and the tumultuous history of running a lot in this city. Get the Side Hustle Ideas Database: https://clickhubspot.com/ogv
author: HubSpot

title: What does winning a James Beard Award really mean for chefs?
description: Often called the Oscars of the food industry, the James Beard Foundation Awards are among the most coveted for chefs in America. But what's sold and packaged as prestige can sometimes become a distraction from managing the business that got you there. Host Matt Brown is joined by The New York Times food critic Brett Anderson & chef Chintan Pandya (Dhamaka, Semma, Adda, Unapologetic Foods) to learn that an award can not only change a winner's life but an entire industry as a whole.
author: HubSpot

title: Tatcha: Vicky Tsai (July 2020)
description: In 2008, Vicky Tsai walked away from a startup job and set out to rediscover herself on a trip to Japan. In Kyoto, she had an unforgettable meeting with a geisha, and learned about the face creams and blotting papers that the traditional Japanese hostesses had used for centuries. But as she contemplated selling those products in the U.S., experts on both sides of the Pacific told her it would never work. Strapped for money and juggling multiple jobs, Vicky worked out of her parents' garage, pitching her new brand‚ÄîTatcha‚Äîon QVC and steadily growing it. In 2019, Unilever acquired Tatcha for a reported $500 million.This episode was produced by Jed Anderson with music composed by Ramtin Arablouei. It was edited by Neva Grant.You can follow HIBT on¬†X¬†&¬†Instagram, and email us at hibt@id.wondery.com. title: Advice Line with Steve Holmes of goba Sports Group
description: Springfree Trampoline founder Steve Holmes joins Guy on the Advice Line, where they answer questions from three early-stage entrepreneurs. Plus, Steve‚Äôs tariff navigation guidance for businesses manufacturing products outside of the U.S.First we meet Ikechukwu in Maryland, who‚Äôs trying to lean into a core demographic¬†without alienating customers from his activewear brand. Then Cody in Nevada, who‚Äôs building a year-round advertising strategy for a largely seasonal product: DEET-free bug repellant. And Kenesha in Ontario, who‚Äôs looking to maintain the momentum of a viral moment for her Caribbean-inspired chocolate.Thank you to the founders of Veii Apparel, Grand Tongo, and One More Cocoa for being a part of our show.If you‚Äôd like to be featured on a future Advice Line episode, leave us a one-minute message that tells us about your business and a specific question you‚Äôd like answered. Send a voice memo to hibt@id.wondery.com or call 1-800-433-1298.And be sure to listen to Springfree Trampoline‚Äôs founding story as told by Steve and the trampoline‚Äôs inventor Keith on the show in 2019.This episode was produced by Sam Paulson with music by Ramtin Arablouei. It was edited by John Isabella.
